reviews.review_text: The five course tasting menu explores a global array of spices and influences paired with beautifully sourced ingredients. Located in the West End, down a set of stairs off Davie St, Arike is an approachable and global dining experience. Every course had a remarkable variance in spice and heat, even the bread which contained bebere spice. My favourite courses were the Moroccan Ratatouille and the Sea Bream Ceviche. The ceviche was notably spicy, in a delightful way, and presented with a peanut hummus. I also had the wine pairing which was a stellar accompaniment. My sister found the melon course with the serrano sofrito and yogurt foam as her favourite. The meal was a wonderful progression from start to finish and we were delighted by it all.

Spectacular. If I could give Arike more stars I would. For both my wife and I, this was one of the best meals weve ever had. We have both visited and lived in various East African countries and were curious to taste the mix of these flavours with local ingredients. Arike delivered, and then some. We also really enjoyed the unique cocktail menu. Some of these cocktails were unlike any wed ever had. Well be back, and with friends next time.
Arike s tasting menu was a burst of flavor  We had the wine pairing and our tastebuds were pleased even though our bellies would argue this due to the portions. Definitely recommend this experience.

Came here during the grand reopening for the tasting menu. It was an incredible & unique experience with perfectly selected natural wine pairings. The bartender had us sample a few different complimentary cocktails as they sorted out their menu. Each cocktail was well-balanced, spirit forward, and layered with complex and intriguing flavours/fragrances. You could tell how passionate both the server, Joel, and the bartender, Awesome, are about food and drink which only accentuated an already delightful evening.

Would give 6 stars. The food here is so unique, stunning combinations of flavors. We had a chicken sausage + red pepper ( I think) gnocchi + mint chutney + baked manchego crisp. Sound good enough yet? Each item on its own was good, like fine, but together it was a sensational eating experience. As if that wasnt enough, the wine pairings were phenomenal (the two of us split one), and the ambience and decor topped it off. Hats off to Sam the chef, Jesse (who Im told did the wine pairings), and Jen the wonderful, fun hostess. Check out Arike when youre in town! And be sure to ask what the logo means :)

Walked by and decided to do a quick turn at a random hole in the wall place. We turned right walking down Davie street down the stairs when we discovered the absolute best bar experience we have ever had in the city. The bartender shared his experience of how his experience through Africa inspired his drinks... we were beyond impressed, he took us on a journey we never thought we would experience in the city. Sweet, sour, elegant, sophisticated, smooth... the city used to be boring and cloudy, but I found my place to enjoy the sun while all of you suckers hide under your umbrellas. Grab at the seat near the bar and say hi to me, I will be there.

The food was fantastic. I do not eat porc and they kindly accommodated their tasting menu to my dietary restrictions. Personally, we expected more Nigerian influence in the food but nonetheless the food was phenomenal. The service was also great

Hospitality at its finest. Between Awesomes cocktail list that reflects his personal journey as a bartender and the service provided by Joel this is a true gem. It was a pleasure to connect with people who care and want to share flavor combinations that work and are anything but ordinary. Thank you for a great evening.

Beyond excellent. Every single bite is packed full of flavour. There were so many  wow  moments. It is clear how much thought, effort, and care goes into every choice that is made. The wine pairing was so worth it! We will definitely be back, and I can t recommend it enough!!

Update: I returned to Arike last night for dinner and had another 5 star experience. We tried the goat spoon, prawns, steak/fries and goat dumplings. Service and the food were all amazing. The presentation, colours and flavours of all the food continue to impress. Original: Arike has quickly become one of my favourite restaurants in Vancouver. Its an amazing experience with great service and Nigerian fusion food done in a fine dining style. Fritters were next level. The flavour and texture. Onion rings were awesome (though small portion) and the cassava fries were good too. They both came with great sauces. Tried the ox tail and pork belly flat bread which was amazing and so was the joffi rice with beef tenderloin. The rice was so flavourful and the beef just melted in your mouth. Tried both desserts and they were amazing too. Best mini donuts ever... almost like gulab jamun mini donuts and best ice cream in West End.

From start to finish this place is amazing! The service was extremely knowledgeable & friendly, they describe the menu as Nigerian fusion. The Cocktails & Flatbreads were to die for. The Cassava Fries were crispy on the outside, soft & fluffy on the inside & the sauces that accompanied them were delicious. The Chicken Wings were well seasoned with a bit of heat, exactly what one would look for in a great Wing. The Corn Fritters were nothing like Ive ever tasted & they had a great little bite of heat. The Pof Pofs, were described as little donut holes but I can tell you right now theyre better than any donut hole Ive ever had & were the perfect way to end our meal. Although this restaurant hasnt been open for long, I know its going to make a name for itself, so grab some friends & head on over there before the word gets out & you have to wait months for a table. I promise you wont be disappointed!

We decided to try Arike since it just opened recently and the smells coming out of the place whenever we walked by it were quite inviting. On the table for 2: Oxtail flat bread, habanero-corn fritters, joloff rice with beef skewers, Milo ice cream. The joloff rice has quite a kick to it so if youre into spicy food, definitely try it out. The beef was excellent and the flavors together really worked. Dont get me started about the corn fritters!! As for the flatbread, well that one hit the nail in the head. With the caramelized onions and the sweetness, oh dear! Well definitely be back until were tried every single item on the menu. Vancouvers missing more places like Arike that just take your tastebuds for a spin!
This was a lovely experience. Every meal was a hit... From the bread and butter through to suya chicken and suya beef, it was all so delicious. Will definitely be going back.

If you love fine dining but are tired of the same (even if delicious) flavors over and over, Arike will wake up your taste buds with new spices, flavors, and combinations and excellent service in an intimate atmosphere.

Friends and I did take out and got the below. All of the dishes were delicious. 1) Jollof Rice 2) Tamarind & Scotch Bonnet Curry (with Beef Shank) 3) Tomato and Cinnamon Curry (with Chicken) 4) Rice Pilaf Our absolutely favourite though was the Tamarind & Scotch Bonnet Curry (with Beef). So tender and flavourful. Just the right amount of sweet too. Will definitely be back.

I knew the food would be good, but this was outstanding. My flavour buds were in ecstasy as I consumed each course. There were so many unique flavours, as well as textures and just a beautiful array of tastes for a dining experience. I cannot suggest this place more to anyone curious. Service was spectacular, ambience was peaceful and warm. Just an overall wonderful experience. I wish I could give 6 stars.

We had an amazing time at Arike Restaurant last night. The food was absolutely amazing! It s one of a kind. The service was impeccable. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting to try something that s not ordinary and is one of a kind. You will love the food! My friend has the wine pairing with the tasting menu. I just had the tasting menu. She co formed that the wine pairing was also perfect! Thank you so much Arike for the great experience!

Truly an exceptional dining experience. The food is simply divine, with expertly prepared meats and seafood bursting with flavor. The service is outstanding, with friendly and knowledgeable staff willing to go above and beyond. And the atmosphere is beautiful, with a cozy, intimate feel thats perfect for a romantic date or special occasion. Trust me, if you want a memorable dining experience in Vancouver, Arike is the place to go.
The food was fantastic! Every dish from the tasting menu was a hit! We will definitely come back since the menu changes frequently.
Unique food, great service. Corn fritters, ice cream and pof pofs were our favourites! Try it!

My wife and I had a great meal here.  A pleasant, understated interior with well spaced tables, and interesting music that was at a reasonable volume   you could have a conversation. Excellent service, our server was very knowledgeable about the food and wine, appeared like magic when you need something, and let you eat in peace when you didn t. The menu changes frequently, but I expect that it will always be of very good quality given our experience. We started with a perfect brioche with Tiger Nut giving it an unique flavor with thin butterscotch on top. A tasty, if sticky way to start the meal. Then a mango dish. We were told it was compressed mango which must made the flavour more intense because it was very intense. The leaves and spices all came together for a very good overall flavor. Next up a yam dish. I m not a big fan of vegetarian dishes (a true omnivore, I am), but I really enjoyed this one. Once again, some new, very good flavours combined in a perfectly executed dish. Then fish, a thin piece of fish on top of fluffy spiced rice, and again a great combination of flavours and textured. Final meat dish was rabbit, but rabbit unlike any I ve had before. I really enjoyed the Nigerian (and other parts of Africa) flavours that were used to inspire these dishes. Dessert gets its own paragraph. I find that dessert is often the poor cousin at restaurants. Not much thought goes into it. It is pretty common to see a sorbet, a Creme Brule, and something chocolate on the dessert menu. You don t get a choice here, but it was wonderful. A cylinder of pasty with spiced apples cubes inside, a creme caramel, and something light and coiled on top. My description isn t doing this dessert justice. It looked great, and tasted better. Not too sweet, not too heavy, a nice combination of flavours and textures, and the chef obviously put a lot of thought, time, and care into creating it. All in all, one of the better meals I ve had in Vancouver. Being Vancouver, it was raining, but in the summer the restaurant is steps way from a nice walk at English Bay which could be a nice activity after a great meal.

Great dining experience, every dish we had was so tasty. There were some really unique flavours that I had never had before but everything was really nicely balanced. Service was great, my only complaint is that it was a bit cold in the restaurant.
Lovely experience at Arike! Go with a few people and share everything, every dish we got was delicious:) Our favourite was the oxtail and pork belly flatbread - a must try!

my boyfriend and i were so looking forward to trying out arike after seeing them on the michelin recommended ! i booked a reso for us on dec.14/22 for 6pm and we were running late but they weren t busy and were super understanding. i rlly like the contact free payment option by pre booking on tock, which was mandatory to get a reso anyway lol. i m writing a review for the first time bc when i was researching this place i didn t see many updated, detailed reviews. first impression, cute spot only 6 tables in the restaurant. i was confused if it was open bc there were no parties seated when i arrived and the sign on the front said open friday and saturday by reservation only ? it has a pretty dark ambience so i got sleepy pretty fast lol. i was greeted by a gentleman (server ? manager ?) who allowed me to seat myself at any table. once we were seated, he introduced himself and asked us if we wanted any wine (we booked for the optional wine pairing) and we decided against it and went for a ginger beer instead. there were 5 courses i believe plus this palate cleanser thing and dessert. super super unique flavours and concept. i would say my favorite was the second course (torched scallop nigiri concept on i think it was jerk rice). i ve never tried a tasting menu before so i was confused why it took so long between each course lol, but i guess im just used to eating and leaving at restaurants. before each course our server explained each dish in detail which was fascinating, and we got to hear the concept behind each dish. the portions were good for me and i left with food coma haha. all in all, i had the most amazing experience here  great service, unique food, for a reasonable price (compared to other restaurants with tasting menus) in a quiet romantic setting. thank u so much for making our night a great one !!

We had been meaning to come to Arike for quite some time. We have some dietary restrictions, which we were able to specify when we made the booking, and we got a prompt response confirming. At the restaurant, the service (our server was Joel) was excellent - courteous, informative and personalized. The food was very tasty, innovative, and perfectly paced. We werent rushed at all, and spent 2.5 hours. The background music was tasteful and soft, and there was not the clamour of background noise so common in restaurants these days. As a result, we were able to converse easily with our friends. Our dining experience was excellent all around, and we look forward to returning.

Food was amazing! Staff friendly, welcoming and attentive. It s a great place to hang out, we stayed way longer than initially planned. I d recommend this restaurant to anyone and will be adding it to my favourites!!

Cant wait to return. Highly recommend and consider it the top restaurant in Vancouver thanks to its amazing atmosphere, approachable dining experience, and great taste for a fair price. Nice pace good for a long conversation with your dining partners and tasty, perfectly seasoned dishes. Vegetarian options: Vegetarian only, no vegan options

yum yum yum this is one of the most delicious dining experiences I have ever had and the service was amazing . You can taste the attention to detail and care in every scrumptious bite it is definitely worth a visit , i d give 6 stars if it was an option .

Had a lovely time with the tasting menu, complete with wine pairings. They also had a vegan option, which was delightful. The food is modern Nigerian-inspired fine dining, and everything about all the courses was great tasting. We especially enjoyed the jollof rice, which was out of this world!
Absolutely amazing food, the flavours really speak for themselves and are unique and impressive. Very friendly service, this is a must try. Can t wait to come back.
Amazing mixed drinks and hospitality! They nailed some custom long island iced teas we wanted, too. However, more servers would help with serving times.
Had the cassava fries, abacha salad, oxtail flatbread and pof pofs -- all of it was delicious. Service was great and they were very friendly. I definitely will be coming back!
This place is unreal. The food was amazing, the sauces are so good, even the spices are favourable and zesty. Do yourself a flavour and come here for dinner.

Great dinner! We took the suggestions from our server and tried some of the most popular dishes: Corn Fritters, Goat Dumplings, Mini Burgers, Onion Rings. We enjoyed everything very much. Service was excellent and pricing very good for the quality of food. Loved the dipping sauces that came with the Onion Rings, theyd be nice with the Corn Fritters too.

Unique dishes bursting with flavour! My friends and I tried every item on the menu and the food just got better and better with each bite. A fantastic meal from beginning to end. Dont even get me started about how delicious their Milo ice cream was. Staff were extremely friendly and attentive. The restaurant has a very cool vibe too. I will be back very soon! I cant wait until their patio opens in the summer and I can enjoy some delicious drinks and snacks. Thank you for the wonderful experience!

Had takeaway tonight. Great service and delicious food. The pies are a real winner with perfect pastry and a delicious beef filling. Also tried a curry and the pineapple chicken. Everything was great. Highly recommend and if you are in the neighborhood phone them directly for takeaway so they don t have to pay those ridiculous fees.

Excellent! The vibe, the service & the food. Girlfriend even said, best onion rings Ive ever had and the Oxtail Boudin...OMG. So good as was the goat dumplings (did not photo). We came for the Dine Out Vancouver experience however their main menu looked so yummy. Im glad we decided to sample a few items off the menu and shared everything. I believe thats the best way to go with their menu. Were already planning a double date night as we want come back here soon. Definitely check it out as I believe its a hidden gem. Considering how much food we ordered including a drink each, the bill was under $85. I was surprised we had the whole restaurant to ourselves even though we arrived at 19:30 on a Wednesday.

What an absolute fabulous spot! My Night starts with a warm welcome I choose to Sit at the bar to enjoy good banter with a great bartender, he knew his cocktails and his wine. The atmosphere and small tucked away location were excellent. As an east coaster the idea of Nigerian food would be extremely foreign and unknown to me. The bartender and server were able to explain the menu to me in a very clear way what the food entitled. It was excellent , menu was very small which I enjoyed as I was able to try 4 different items in the menu, One as great as the next. I can t wait to go back with a bigger party to enjoy everything on the menu. I can t comment on its authenticity ( I ve never had Nigerian food ) but it seemed pretty legit to me. I sure hope this one sticks, The west end and Vancouver need a spot like this.

We had a wonderful meal here on Friday night. The food was delicious and unique, both in flavor and presentation. The corn fritters and dessert ice cream were definitely highlights! Ill be returning for both very soon!
Creative, delicious tasting menu and a thoughtful wine pairing. The service was excellent

Amazing food that is comforting, sophisticated and delicious. Exquisite cocktails; very unique. Atmosphere was beautiful with live plants and was quite cozy. Highly recommend this restaurant for a special night out, drinks with a friend or if youre in the mood for some wholesome cuisine with a flare.

Went here to meet up with some friends. Its a very nice hole in the wall restaurant. The atmosphere was clean and quiet but not boring. Extremely cozy. I could imagine ending up here on a brisk Vancouver winter day for a bite to eat. The staff, all excellent at their jobs and professional they take their jobs seriously. The food was interesting and full of flavour.

Exceptional Food!  Different in a very positive way.  The chefs are genius!  The food is very flavourful and unique... a taste extravaganza!  Take out at the moment but we cant wait till they can serve inside again.  Looking for something different?  Here is your spot!

Amazing. They have happy hour from 3-6 and after 9 (some appies, flatbreads and drinks are cheaper) as well as daily drink specials. We ordered one flatbread, an appy, and a side to share amongst the four of us. The suya BBQ chicken wings ($11 during happy hr, $15 regular) were juicy, warm and finger-licking good, and definitely a good deal for the price since we got about 1lb/12 wings. The oxtail and pork belly flatbread ($17) was a bit spicier than wed expected, but the heat wasnt overpowering and the sweet caramelized onions paired perfectly with the richness of the cheese. The cassava fries ($7) were golden and crispy on the outside but as fluffy as mashed potatoes on the inside, though the cashew garlic mayo was much less flavourful than the hot and sweet tomato dip. For around $10 per person, it was a filling and very affordable meal. The server was incredibly friendly and charismatic. I also loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. A lovely cocktail bar, dim lighting and a hidden but cozy location make Arike the perfect place to meet with friends and family and share conversation over good food.

Surprisingly delicious food!!! If you want to try something new, this is really good way. I dont like to compare international kitchens but this one is similar to Indian with spark of something more exotic! Thanks for this experience!
Amazing experience! Everything on the tasting menu was exceptional, and the wine pairing was perfect. Best tasting menu in Vancouver.

The food was excellent! I worried a little about the heat but was pleasantly surprised when I found it had been slightly adjusted to the Canadian pallet. The drinks were well crafted and of a decent selection. A definite must try.

Pacific Northwest meets West African.  Wonderfully executed food and cocktail menu.  Roman behind the bar knows his cocktails, and how to run a bar: its the best French 75 Ive had this side of the Atlantic.  The chefs are knocking it out of the park on the food side: the spoonful of braised goat is that perfectly executed hors doeuvres with sandwiches and salads that go well beyond expectations, but its the unique flatbread and, in my personal opinion, the dumplings, that really stand out.  Dessert was the real kicker: in house ice cream with caramel and pumpkin seed puree, paired with a shot of espresso. I was in heaven.  Almost makes me wish it was an affogato. Lastly, this place is spotless.  Its refreshing to be in a place that is as clean behind the bar as it is out front.  To quote a patron I heard the evening I visited: You could do heart surgery back there.  Worth the visit.  You wont leave disappointed.

The food here is amazing! Arike adds a different type of food Vancouver lacks. We ordered the corn fritters, ata din din wings, fried jollof rice and the pulled oxtail &cured pork belly flatbread. The service was excellent and the music dope. Will return! Thanks again

MUST EAT HERE!! The menu is out of this world!! I am not familiar with this style of cuisine so was not sure what to expect when ordering anything. My best advice is to ask for recommendations and you will not be disappointed. Been here twice now and both times everything was extra tasty. Love the cosy feeling of the restaurant location and the area is super convenient! If you don t eat here, I feel sorry for you!

Nigerian Canadian fusion restaurant with deliciously cured meats, contemporary aesthetic and fresh cocktails in a great Davie Street location. I loved my time there and didnt feel uncomfortable eating alone at one of the communal high tables, the staff were excellent and made great recommendations. The goat spoon with spicey ata din din sauce and crushed peanuts is a good way to start your meal. Most plates are for sharing and I highly suggest the three-month cured lamb flatbread because it bursts with flavour. Both the desserts are great and not too sweet, the ice cream has a thick pumpkin seed smear which is very unique, the pof pofs are light deep fried sweet bundles of goodness. Overall a great dinner for those who like carb-based smaller shared plates with five star local service.
Flavors and presentation exquisite. Had vegan tasting menu with wine pairing. Highly recommend.

10 months post launch of Arike, eventually made it with two of my friends... The food was great and very tasty (just FYI in small portions), perfect location in the heart of Vancouver, We also met the chef; Great guy! Definitely going back...
Amazing food! Definitely comeback again!

Great to have a go to Nigerian restaurant in Vancouver. My friends and I made a reservation and showed up on time, we were greeted immediately and shown our seats. We had tons of dishes to share; I highly recommend the jollof rice, chicken wings, akara onion ring and the leg of lamb flatbread was amazing! (like a party in my mouth). The milo ice cream is also a great dessert option. I am really excited to explore the rest of the menu and we will definitely be back.

Dear Arike Staff, You don t get to see our eyes light up when we open the containers of your food, or our nods and yummy noises as we take our first bites, but I promise you, that is happening. How you get those pie crusts to melt like they do is outrageous. The coconut rice is a delight. Stay well and we will see you when we can.
Superb flavours! A fine introduction to Nigerian cousine. Try the tomato and cinnamon curry, plus the coconut rice pilaf, plus.... You cant go wrong with any choice.

Have been twice now and just gets better.  The food is real tasty and not like anything else Ive found.  Great for sharing... if you must. So glad we popped our heads in have found a new jem. Service was great and a real nice vibe in there. Will be back again soon
This is a gem. Lovely atmosphere and the food and wine parings were flawless. Cannot recommend enough and will be back to see next month s menu.
Fantastic 7 course menu & amazing staff. Cannot recommend this place enough.
I love the fusion of Nigerian with Western! I had the 5-course menu and every plate was delicious! Will certainly visit again.
Very delicious food. We tried a few different dishes and everything was great. From the Goat Spoon, to the Jaloff Rice, the flatbread and desserts. Go check out this place.

The food and service here is top notch! We live across the street and it has quickly become our go to after the pub.  Haven t left bite behind when eating there.  Do your self a favour and try everything!
Excellent! Every bite was interesting and delicious. Couldnt fault it. We will be returning.
Amazing service, and each course was a little work of art -- I love the effort that went into my dining experience. A++

In Vancouver on holiday and decided to try out this restaurant.Service was excellent and the food was very very good. The jollof rice was very authentic, the suya was good! Would highly recommend and would definitely visit again!
I had mini burgers appetizer, followed by a lamb flat bread. I also tried both desserts - an ice cream and pof pofs. Everything was awesome!!
Incredible vegan and non-vegan tasting menus, with great wine pairings and outstanding service. Highly recommend!!!
Super flavorful food and a very cozy ambience! The service was really great; they were welcoming and friendly! Would highly recommend
Wow, wow, wow. Thank you Joel.  We had a great night - great food, great wine, great service. Food
Fantastic, unique and distinctive tapas food with super friendly staff and a really nice vibe. Great addition to the neighborhood! Go try it out!
Amazing food and atmosphere! Beautiful plating with gorgeous flavors. Can t wait to go back
Definitely worth a second visit!  Great good and service.  Loved the food Dont pass by this new treasure tucked away in a Vancouver.
Wow! An absolutely amazing fusion of flavours and textures. The food is the best and the staff are just wonderful.
Phenomenal menu, wonderful wine pairings, first-rate service. I cannot rate this highly enough!!
Offers a unique dining experience for the city and excellent service. The menu isnt large, but sharing is encouraged.
Cool spot just below the street level.  We had a group of 8 and everyone had great food and drinks!
Really nice food with excellent customer service. Number 1 on the list of restaurants for nice food in Vancouver.
Delicious vegan tasting menu, top service and attention to detail!
The food was delicious and the restaurant was nicely decorated. Will definitely come back.
Excellent food, great service. And the prices are fantastic for the quality of the food.
Rare Nigerian cuisine!  Great place tucked away under random businesses on Davie.
Food is incredible, creative and delicious
Great service, excellent food. A great mean from beginning to end.
It was so good! So much better than expected. Will definitely be back
Very special place! Highly recommend!
Very unique and delicious flatbreads!
Delightful flavours and very pleasant service!
Great food and good vibes. Give it a whirl
Great food !!!
Decent bar . One should must come here
Loved the food and special bowl.
I will go there again!
Great decor and good food.
Cool place, nice food
Best
Very good!
Good beginnings
Great food
